area.name: Common Messages
area.entry: Lawson Smart Office has encountered a problem

We are sorry for the inconvenience. Please tell Lawson about this problem and provide the log file and information of the steps leading up to it. Press the Support button to save the log file at a location of your choice.
If the problem persists, restart Lawson Smart Office or contact a system administrator.
If the problem persists, contact a system administrator.
The user {0} could not be authenticated
The user {0} could not be authenticated for the system {1}
Verify that your user has access to the system.
Unable to communicate with the server {0}
Unable to communicate with the server
Verify that your network connection is working.
Please contact your system administrator or try again later.
The request to the server timed out.
You can retry the operation now, wait and retry later or close the program.

area.name: Shortcut Window
area.entry: To add a shortcut to the Toolbox area, select an option in the Available Options list and add it to My Shortcuts. Arrange your added shortcuts by dragging them or moving them up and down within the list. To remove a shortcut, select it and click Remove.

entry.name: MashupAppName
entry.comment: Translators: Mashup is 'A screen that combines functionality or data from multiple sources into a single, integrated service, application, or medium. Lawson Smart Office allows any user to create a mashup using XAML.' See http://www.microsoft.com/language/en/us/default.mspx for translations.

entry.name: PART_MenuItemRestore
entry.comment: Do NOT translate the '_' sign. It's used to underline the following letter. If the translation contains an 'R' or 'r', move the '_' sign before the 'r', otherwise remove the '_' from the translation. I.e. if the translation was 'AnotherWord', the translation would be 'AnotherWo_rd'.

entry.name: PART_MenuItemMove
entry.comment: Do NOT translate the '_' sign. It's used to underline the following letter. If the translation contains an 'M' or 'm', move the '_' sign before the 'm', otherwise remove the '_' from the translation.

entry.name: PART_MenuItemSize
entry.comment: Do NOT translate the '_' sign. It's used to underline the following letter. If the translation contains an 'S' or 's', move the '_' sign before the 's', otherwise remove the '_' from the translation.

entry.name: PART_MenuItemMinimize
entry.comment: Do NOT translate the '_' sign. It's used to underline the following letter. If the translation contains an 'N' or 'n', move the '_' sign before the 'n', otherwise remove the '_' from the translation.

entry.name: PART_MenuItemMaximize
entry.comment: Do NOT translate the '_' sign. It's used to underline the following letter. If the translation contains an 'X' or 'x', move the '_' sign before the 'x', otherwise remove the '_' from the translation.

entry.name: PART_MenuItemClose
entry.comment: Do NOT translate the '_' sign. It's used to underline the following letter. If the translation contains an 'C' or 'c', move the '_' sign before the 'c', otherwise remove the '_' from the translation.

area.name: Export Dialog

entry.name: FormatM3InfoHeader
entry.comment: Info header

area.entry: Define the format of the system data in each column below. In the list, select the column headers one at a time and set the data format under 'Column format' below.
Define meta data to be used by the conversion module, to convert finance data from 'Alpha numeric' to 'Numeric'.
Select the range of rows you want to export to Excel below.
Export all rows (A maximum of 9999 rows can be exported)
Note: Exporting all rows may take several minutes to execute.
Select the rows you want to export in the {0} list, and then select Export to Excel.

area.name: Export Split Dialog
area.entry: Type the characters that should split the data.

entry.name: SplitFirstChar
entry.comment: Value in TextBox

entry.name: SplitSecondChar
entry.comment: Value in TextBox

entry.name: SplitOk
entry.comment: Split is a verb here. Means to separate data that will be exported into an Excel column. The user can enter a character or a letter that will indicate where the data will be split.

area.name: Export Format Dialog
area.entry: Select the right date format for the '{0}' column

area.name: Export Template Edit
area.entry: Name and describe your new template. Verify that the data format of each column has been correctly identified. Then select or right-click the column headers in the list to format their content or layout.
Edit your template. Verify that the data format of each column has been correctly identified. Then select or right-click the column headers in the list to format their content or layout.

Name and describe your new template copy. Verify that the data format of each column has been correctly identified. Then select or right-click the column headers in the list to format their content or layout.
Edit the provider formats. This is the configuration of the system data, and the base definition to which all templates refer.
Do you want to save the current format as a template?
Choose a template to export, edit or copy.

area.name: Appearance
area.entry: Selecting this mode will reduce the number of colors and shades in program windows. This option will enhance the Smart Office experience in situations where color representation is limited. This setting does not affect the representation of the Smart Office Canvas or Widgets.

entry.name: LoadingTheme
entry.comment: Progress dialog message when loading a new theme.

area.name: Conditional Styles Wizard
area.entry: A conditional style is a format, such as background color or font style, that is applied to fields if a specified condition is true. To create a new conditional style for a field, click New. You can also edit, copy, or delete the conditional styles you created.

Conditions in the list are evaluated from top to bottom, and the first condition that is met is applied. Change the order of the conditions by clicking a condition and then clicking Move Up or Move Down.
Are you sure you want to delete this conditional style?

Select the target field for which you want to create a conditional style, and then select the type of condition. Depending on the type you select, Lawson Smart Office displays the condition that you can use.
To apply the conditional style at all times when the condition is met, do not set a date interval.
To apply the conditional style a certain amount of days before, and a certain amount of days after the condition is met, set the number of days below.
Enter an optional name and description for the conditional style and select Activate to activate it.
Add the dates that you want to include in the conditional style comparison.
Make your formatting selections for the field and text, such as color, text style, and icon.
The end of the date interval is before the start.

area.name: Conditional Styles Descriptions
area.entry: Show original value as a tooltip

area.name: Personalization Manager
area.entry: Use this wizard to manage the application personalizations. It provides the ability to delete and make copies of existing personalizations. To begin select the Personalization type and either double click or highlight a source and click Select.
Highlight the personalizations on which to take action and click the appropriate button.
Highlight the personalizations on which to take action and click the appropriate button or double-click a folder entry to see it's contents.
The following list of personalizations will be deleted.
Select the target for the copy operation and then click the Copy button.
Click to select one or more existing roles not listed
Enter User Name (Note: entry not validated)
Click to select a user name not listed
Click to manage other types of personalizations

area.name: Jabber

entry.name: Jabber
entry.comment: Jabber Instant Messaging

area.entry: Add users from an internal or external Jabber service as contacts.

entry.name: JabberSearch
entry.comment: For the search query input field

area.entry: Check this to enable Single Sign On (SSO) for Jabber. The Jabber server must be configured to authenticate using the same user repository that is used for the client.
Check this to allow the user to enter their own values for user, server and port.
The name of the Jabber server. This value can be blank if there is no central Jabber server and the users are allowed to change their own settings.
The port number for the Jabber server or blank to use the default port number.
The network hostname or IP address of the server to connect to. Leave blank if the server name and the hostname are the same.

entry.name: JabberRequireSSL

entry.name: SavedSearchWidgetTitle

area.entry: Locate and start Lawson programs, forms, tools, jobs, and reports. Organize your favorites and most recently viewed content.
Get the latest news and updated content from your favorite web sites that offer RSS feeds.
Create shortcuts on the canvas for quick access to content from your computer, your network, or the Internet.
Keep track of time around the world with multiple clocks that display the locations and time zones of your choice.
Type a note or reminder to yourself, or drag and drop text from any text field in a Lawson program.
View the current profile setup for Lawson Smart Office.
Create a personalized photo calendar that is always on the canvas.
Perform basic arithmetic tasks with the calculator.
Read and reply to incoming messages, events, and alerts from different communication channels.
Publish announcements to groups of colleagues and other Lawson Smart Office users.
Count down the time in hours, minutes, and seconds to remind yourself of important events.
Organize your shortcuts and launch them directly from the canvas, either individually or all at once.
Show real-time processor activity on your computer.
Show the number of users who are logged on to Lawson Smart Office.
Download your e-mail from different mail accounts.
Show the memory usage on your computer.
Show the latest value from a business data feed.

entry.name: WatchListWidgetDescription
entry.comment: See definition of Watchlist. Do NOT translate the product name Business Intelligence.

entry.name: SavedSearchWidgetDescription
entry.comment: The description, displayed in the widget library, for the Saved search widget

area.entry: Save a search as a widget and have it refresh the search continously.

area.entry: Path to the externa application. Depending on type, this value means either a file path, a registry path or an environment variable.

entry.name: TypeToolTip

area.entry: Type specifies how the value Path should be used. File path, registry value or environment variable.

entry.name: Index
entry.comment: Decides in which order the menu items are shown.

entry.name: IndexToolTip

area.entry: Index specifies in which order the menu entrys are shown in the Navigator. Possible values are 1-9999.

entry.name: NewExternalAppNameToolTip

area.entry: The name is only a name used in the System Profile editor to group settings for one External Application.

area.entry: Valid characters are a-z and A-Z.
